intro: Geophila fissistipula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive fissured or notched tip. It produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Geophila fissistipula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes.
